content:
• Wednesday, April 4, 2012
  • FRAN

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) files a secondary offering to sell 9M shares of common stock...

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) files a secondary offering to sell 9M shares of common stock for certain members of management and directors of the company, plus affiliates of CCMP Capital Advisors. Shares -1.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) +2.1% AH after stating it has acquired the Deer Hunter brand from...

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) +2.1% AH after stating it has acquired the Deer Hunter brand from Atari. Glu, recently the subject of takeover speculation, has been offering mobile games based on the Deer Hunter franchise for the last 7 years, and has generated over $21M in revenue from them along the way. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) -3.8% AH after reporting sales for the 5-week period ending March 31...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) -3.8% AH after reporting sales for the 5-week period ending March 31 totaled $50.9M (+23.5%), and that same-store sales rose 14.1% during this time. As of today's close, shares had risen 18% since Zumiez posted its last monthly sales report.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • RT

    More on Ruby Tuesday's (NYSE:RT) FQ3 report: Gain in revenue primarily due to fiscal 2011...

    More on Ruby Tuesday's (NYSE:RT) FQ3 report: Gain in revenue primarily due to fiscal 2011 franchise partnership acquisitions, offset by a 5.0% same restaurant sales decrease. Plans to close 31-33 underperforming stores in FQ4. Lowers guidance for FY12 EPS to $0.43-$0.48 vs. $0.55-$0.65 prior. Sees same-store sales tailing off 4.0%-4.5%. Expects free cash flow to be $75M-$85M. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • RT

    More on Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue due...

    More on Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue due to weak overall sales. Revenue growth was relatively flat Y/Y, as same store sales comps fell 5%. The company also guides its FY12 EPS lower, now expecting to earn between $0.43 -$0.48 per share, below Street estimates of $0.58. Shares -12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • HEAT

    Momentum traders were all over SmartHeat (HEAT +46.3%) again today after shares spiked 91%...

    Momentum traders were all over SmartHeat (HEAT +46.3%) again today after shares spiked 91% yesterday, even as Q4 results were dismal vs. 2010 due to "a very challenging sales environment." The move even spilled over to some rivals: THTI +80.5%, CLNT +157.8%. But it could end up ugly: "When the music stops, don't be the last one standing."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • BBBY

    More on Bed Bath and Beyond's (NASDAQ:BBBY) FQ4: Same-store sales +6.8% Y/Y, better than FQ3's...

    More on Bed Bath and Beyond's (NASDAQ:BBBY) FQ4: Same-store sales +6.8% Y/Y, better than FQ3's 4.1% and blowing past Bernstein's estimate. $359M worth of shares repurchased. The company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.79-$0.83 ($0.82 consensus) and FY12 (ends Feb. '13) EPS to "increase by a high single to a low double digit percentage" (consensus is for 10% increase to $4.47). Shares +6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • RT

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $325M (+1.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $325M (+1.8% Y/Y) misses by $11M. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q4 EPS of $1.48 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $2.73B (+9.1%...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q4 EPS of $1.48 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $2.73B (+9.1% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • PMCS

    PMC-Sierra (PMCS +8.5%) soared in late trading thanks to a report the telecom chipmaker recently...

    PMC-Sierra (PMCS +8.5%) soared in late trading thanks to a report the telecom chipmaker recently held talks with potential buyers, though it's added a deal "is not considered imminent." PMC has been under pressure from activist firm Relational Investors to consider "strategic alternatives." Sources add rivals Broadcom (BRCM) and Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) are "logical bidders" for PMC, though analysts think its exposure to legacy technologies such as SONET optical gear could be a problem.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $51.6M (-5.5% Y/Y)...

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $51.6M (-5.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ2 EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $550M (+22.3% Y/Y) beats...

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ2 EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $550M (+22.3% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • UAA

    Under Armour (UA -3.7%) shares stumble after the athletic-gear maker is cut to Hold from Buy by...

    Under Armour (UA -3.7%) shares stumble after the athletic-gear maker is cut to Hold from Buy by Stifel Nicolaus based on valuation. The firm says while it's impressed with UA's long-run brand potential and capacity for margin improvement, "preliminary views of FY13 growth and earnings power suggest upside potential to shares is more limited near-term."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -2.6%) is likely to report a disappointing Q1, says RBC Capital. It's reducing its EPS...

    Alcoa (AA -2.6%) is likely to report a disappointing Q1, says RBC Capital. It's reducing its EPS estimate to below consensus, as the firm expects the company's results to be hurt by increased energy costs, scheduled maintenance, and adverse currency movements.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • THOR-OLD

    JPMorgan weighs in on Neutral-rated Thoratec (THOR-OLD -4.5%) after the firm recalled its...

    JPMorgan weighs in on Neutral-rated Thoratec (THOR-OLD -4.5%) after the firm recalled its HeartMate device prompting a rapid-fire selloff. Analysts with JP call the action a "non-event" since the issue was related to the heart pump's implementation instructions rather than the device itself. Shares are now down 4.5% after spiraling 12.5% lower earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • TISI

    Shares of Team Inc. (TISI -11.7%) get hammered after missing its on its FQ3 results late...

    Shares of Team Inc. (TISI -11.7%) get hammered after missing its on its FQ3 results late yesterday, Despite a 25% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net income actually fell 48% as the industrial-services company faced tough Y/Y comps that were boosted by a tax credit.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • AMZN

    Investors underestimate the variable costs in Amazon’s (AMZN -2.9%) business, costs that...

    Investors underestimate the variable costs in Amazon’s (AMZN -2.9%) business, costs that could hold back margins for longer than expected, Morgan Stanley says in reiterating an Equal Weight rating on shares. While investors are dazzled with the “incremental gross margin” AMZN achieves, those figures “exclude relevant variable costs, which artificially inflate reported gross margins.”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • MDCA

    MDC Partners (MDCA +3.2%) raises guidance for FY 2012, citing recent investments that have...

    MDC Partners (MDCA +3.2%) raises guidance for FY 2012, citing recent investments that have benefited its income, and switches to a semi-annual dividend from a quarterly payout. The ad agency operator also acquires a "significant minority" stake in Doner, one of the biggest independent agencies.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON -1.5%) shares have turned sharply lower despite beating FQ2 earnings estimates and...

    Monsanto (MON -1.5%) shares have turned sharply lower despite beating FQ2 earnings estimates and posting a 15% Y/Y revenue increase. MON raised its full-year EPS guidance to $3.49-$3.54 vs. $3.39-$3.44 prior, but it wasn't enough to please some analysts. Belittling the guidance hike, S&PÂ Capital IQ points to "early spring weather that pulled some seed deliveries forward."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • BBY

    S&P places Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) BBB- rating on a credit watch with negative implications...

    S&P places Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) BBB- rating on a credit watch with negative implications due to a business model that it says "is not working" and a lack of progress by the retailer to improve its performance. The ratings agency will meet with company management before issuing a final determination on whether Best Buy's rating will fall into junk status. Shares broke lower off the news and now stand down 3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • GPS

    Gap (GPS +1.6%) may "disproportionately benefit" from a recovery in teen apparel spending, Piper...

    Gap (GPS +1.6%) may "disproportionately benefit" from a recovery in teen apparel spending, Piper Jaffray says in upgrading shares of the retailer to Overweight from Neutral. The firm says spending on fashion for both upper- and average-income teens is posting double-digit gains for the first time since 2003-04, and the trend could mean "we are entering a multiyear apparel recovery cycle."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • LEDS

    Rebounding component demand from TV OEMs (previously) is providing a lift to Taiwanese LED...

    Rebounding component demand from TV OEMs (previously) is providing a lift to Taiwanese LED chipmakers, reports Digitimes. Firms are said to be posting utilization rates in the 70%-90% range - a positive for an industry hit hard by oversupply. The report could be contributing to the healthy performance of Taiwan's SemiLEDs (LEDS +2.3%); U.S. rival Cree (CREE -4.2%) is following the tech sector lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -17.8%) gives back a chunk of the past two days gains, as investor take profits off...

    Vringo (VRNG -17.8%) gives back a chunk of the past two days gains, as investor take profits off an +86% windfall run. The stock has soared since Monday on heavy volume, on the back of James Altucher's article over the weekend speculating on its patent infringement case.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • THO

    Shares of Thoratec Industries (THO -5.4%) head south after the company recalls its Heartmate...

    Shares of Thoratec Industries (THO -5.4%) head south after the company recalls its Heartmate System ventricular assist device due to risk the product could detach.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (HOGS -2.7%) falls to $10.65 after investor Phillip Meeks sues to stop chairman/CEO...

    Zhongpin (HOGS -2.7%) falls to $10.65 after investor Phillip Meeks sues to stop chairman/CEO Xianfu Zhu from taking the company private at a price of $13.50/share. Meeks calls Zhu's offer "wholly inadequate" relative to the food/meat processor's intrinsic value.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • MSFT

    Fodder for the technicians: Microsoft (MSFT -2.7%) crashes beneath its 50-day moving average at...

    Fodder for the technicians: Microsoft (MSFT -2.7%) crashes beneath its 50-day moving average at the same time its chart forms a nasty head and shoulders pattern. (h/t John Melloy)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -12.2%) sink after Abbott Laboratories (ABT +0.6%)...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX -12.2%) sink after Abbott Laboratories (ABT +0.6%) releases positive results from studies of its experimental hepatitis C treatment. Other Hep-C companies vying for a piece of the rapidly-growing multi-billion dollar market: Gilead Sciences (GILD -2.2%), Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.2%), Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -0.5%), BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX -3.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • HIG

    U.S. regulators are finalizing a process to spotlight some nonbank financial companies for...

    U.S. regulators are finalizing a process to spotlight some nonbank financial companies for tougher oversight, a key step before formally identifying which firms pose a threat to the financial system. KBW says this poses questions for Hartford Financial (HIG -2.4%), saying it's not clear whether HIG will be considered systemically important based on its derivatives liabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Best Buy's (BBY -1.4%) online prices averaged 4.2% higher than Amazon's (AMZN -3.1%), according...

    Best Buy's (BBY -1.4%) online prices averaged 4.2% higher than Amazon's (AMZN -3.1%), according to a Barclays survey that does not paint BBY in a flattering light. Best Buy could claim the best buy on just 4% of products, while AMZN offered a better price on 54%. BBY also offered free shipping on fewer items, and was less competitive on taxes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • ALGT

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.2%) trades up after Raymond James ups its rating to to outperform,...

    Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.2%) trades up after Raymond James ups its rating to to outperform, saying it expects recently introduced carry-on bag fees to drive earnings higher and make up for delays in the company's 16-seat project and ramp up service to Hawaii.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE -3.9%) takes another step in its "four screens" strategy by appointing Kunimasa Suzuki...

    Sony (SNE -3.9%) takes another step in its "four screens" strategy by appointing Kunimasa Suzuki as head of its struggling mobile phone ops. Among other things, Suzuki already overseas Sony's PC and tablet businesses, with the fourth element of the strategy - TVs - being run by CEO Kazuo Hirai.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • WDC

    Much of the commentary regarding SanDisk's (SNDK -9.5%) Q1 warning involves the solid-state...

    Much of the commentary regarding SanDisk's (SNDK -9.5%) Q1 warning involves the solid-state drive (SSD) market. While NAND flash demand for smartphones and tablets is healthy (though SanDisk's lack of exposure to Apple and Samsung could be a problem), the SSD picture is complex. Raymond James thinks SanDisk and Micron (MU -5.1%) are seeing mere short-term weakness ahead of ultrabook launches, but Jefferies is worried ultrabook demand could disappoint. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (AYI -7.2%) slips after its FQ2 EPS missed estimates, despite a 10% jump in Y/Y...

    Acuity Brands (AYI -7.2%) slips after its FQ2 EPS missed estimates, despite a 10% jump in Y/Y revenue. Net earnings actually fell 2% as higher material costs and operating losses in Spain offset the lighting company's solid top-line growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • DECK

    Auriga weighs in on Deckers Outdoor (DECK -1.8%) with a reiterated Buy rating and a lofty price...

    Auriga weighs in on Deckers Outdoor (DECK -1.8%) with a reiterated Buy rating and a lofty price target of $100 on shares. Analysts forecast an in-line Q1 as cost pressures persist, but see stronger EPS potential for the second half of the year and 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 5 Comments
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX -1.7%) is worth a look at current levels, says ThinkEquity. The firm believes the...

    Emulex (ELX -1.7%) is worth a look at current levels, says ThinkEquity. The firm believes the stock's recent weakness reflects concerns surrounding the Broadcom (BRCM -3.4%) lawsuit, which it expects to have a minimal impact. The firm believes ELX will benefit from the Romley ramp and recommends buying the shares ahead of its Q3 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • AVP

    Take the money and run. That's the advice from TheStreet's Chris Laudani after gazing back over...

    Take the money and run. That's the advice from TheStreet's Chris Laudani after gazing back over Avon's (AVP +2.3%) Q4 results and factoring in the difficulty in merging a tried-and-true cosmetics company with Avon's giant sales force. This week's 17.8% run up in share price makes for a good exit point for Avon investors - instead of waiting in earnest for a higher bid from Cody, he argues.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM

  • Money manager TCP Capital (TCPC) opened at $14.40 after pricing its 5.75M share IPO at $14.75,...

    Money manager TCP Capital (TCPC) opened at $14.40 after pricing its 5.75M share IPO at $14.75, and is now trading at $14.21, down 3.7%. TCP, which primarily invests in debt held by middle-market companies, generated investment income of $54.9M in 2011, $42.1M of which came from interest income. (N-2 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • DF

    Shares of Dean Foods (DF +1.5%) shrug off a downgrade from Oxen Group to Hold from Buy and move...

    Shares of Dean Foods (DF +1.5%) shrug off a downgrade from Oxen Group to Hold from Buy and move higher on word that the company won a dismissal in a milk price-fixing case in Tennessee.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • QSR

    Tim Horton (THI -1.8%) shares are lowered to Neutral from Buy at Goldman Sachs, which sees...

    Tim Horton (THI -1.8%) shares are lowered to Neutral from Buy at Goldman Sachs, which sees better opportunities among other restaurant chains while remaining positive on the stock in the long run. Unlike Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX), THI would see almost no benefit from falling coffee prices given its 99% franchised operating structure, the firm adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • PII

    Polaris Industries (PII -4%) sinks after being downgraded to Market Perform on valuation at...

    Polaris Industries (PII -4%) sinks after being downgraded to Market Perform on valuation at Wells Fargo. However, the firm raised its price target range to $76 - $80 from $68 - $72, saying that longer-term trends still remain positive.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • PPO

    Shares of Polypore (NYSE:PPO) tack on a 4.5% gain after GM decides to add a week to its...

    Shares of Polypore (NYSE:PPO) tack on a 4.5% gain after GM decides to add a week to its production schedule for Chevy Volts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • USO

    Crude oil steepens its slide following a larger-than-expected inventory build. WTI crude -2% to...

    Crude oil steepens its slide following a larger-than-expected inventory build. WTI crude -2% to $101.97. USO -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 6 Comments
  • MU

    Shares of Micron Technology (MU -4.9%) tail off after SanDisk cuts its outlook and shines a...

    Shares of Micron Technology (MU -4.9%) tail off after SanDisk cuts its outlook and shines a spotlight back toward Micron's own problems. RBC Capital's Doug Freedman warns on the outlook for flash memory demand, saying anyone who is not an Apple or Samsung is burning through current inventory instead of placing new orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (AGO -3.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at UBS, with a reduced price...

    Assured Guaranty (AGO -3.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at UBS, with a reduced price target of $18 from $28, as Moody's review for possible downgrade of AGO's operating subsidiaries means it is "highly probable" that AGO's ratings will slip into single-A, which likely would limit new-business opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -5.3%) will stop selling its QuickSite and QuickFlex left-ventricular...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -5.3%) will stop selling its QuickSite and QuickFlex left-ventricular leads, wires that help pace the heart in patients with heart failure, after 39 reports of the wires protruding from their insulation. STJ has been dealing with the same problem in its recalled Riata wires that connect life-saving defibrillators to the heart.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • DYN

    Shares of Dynegy (DYN -21.1%) sink after the firm announces that it reached a settlement with...

    Shares of Dynegy (DYN -21.1%) sink after the firm announces that it reached a settlement with creditors over $2.5B in claims against one its subsidiaries. Under the terms of the deal, unsecured creditors will receive common equity repping a 99% stake in a reorganized company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion (SIMO -3.2%) underperforms in the wake of NAND flash memory giant SanDisk's Q1...

    Silicon Motion (SIMO -3.2%) underperforms in the wake of NAND flash memory giant SanDisk's Q1 warning. CLSA notes Silicon Motion gets roughly half of its revenue from sales of NAND flash controller chips, and doesn't believe Street estimates are taking a warning of SanDisk's magnitude into account.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • LUV

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +2.3%) trades higher after Barclays boosts its rating up to Overweight...

    Southwest Airlines (LUV +2.3%) trades higher after Barclays boosts its rating up to Overweight from Equal Weight on a valuation call. Shares of LUV briefly touched $8.50 after being range-bound for close to a month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • WBMD

    Shares of WebMD (WBMD -7.8%) fall sharply after the firm reports preliminary results from a...

    Shares of WebMD (WBMD -7.8%) fall sharply after the firm reports preliminary results from a tender offer of shares. The company expects to acquire ~5.769M shares at $26 a pop.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • MAGS

    Shares of Magal Security Systems (MAGS +34.6%), an Israeli-based supplier of computerized...

    Shares of Magal Security Systems (MAGS +34.6%), an Israeli-based supplier of computerized security systems, hit a 52-week high after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.27 vs. a net loss of $0.14/share in the year-ago period, and revenues jumped 122% to $33.7M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) roars to a 4.5% gain after reporting strong Q4 earnings led by...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) roars to a 4.5% gain after reporting strong Q4 earnings led by growth in its equipment leasing segment. The company says that it expects strong demand for seismic services through FY13.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK -8.8%) shares slide after last night's downside Q1 guidance due to weaker than...

    SanDisk (SNDK -8.8%) shares slide after last night's downside Q1 guidance due to weaker than expected pricing and demand, and a downgrade to Outperform from Top Pick at RBC. The firm says accelerated pricing declines are stripping out EPS leverage, but it likes SNDK longer term "given second-half demand drivers," including smartphone, tablet, and ultrabook demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • BMY

    Shares of Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) trade up 2.4% premarket after the company's board gets a...

    Shares of Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) trade up 2.4% premarket after the company's board gets a tongue-lashing from Carl Icahn who wants Amylin to sell itself for north of $22 and is displeased with options given to execs last month amid a dilution of shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) -24.3% premarket after announcing BARDA has declined to invite...

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) -24.3% premarket after announcing BARDA has declined to invite submission of a full proposal for continued development funding of CBLB502 as a drug candidate to protect healthy tissues from acute stresses such as radiation and chemotherapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures continue yesterday's sell-off despite a decent and in-line...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures continue yesterday's sell-off despite a decent and in-line ADP jobs report, with the S&P 500 benchmark -0.9%. The action's back in Europe today, where shares are lower, and Spanish and Italian bond yields are surging following a poor auction in Spain. Later: ISM Non-Manufacturing Index, EIA Petroleum Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of US Airways (LCC) move up 2.5% premarket after the carrier reports March traffic was up...

    Shares of US Airways (LCC) move up 2.5% premarket after the carrier reports March traffic was up 4.5% and steps up its rhetoric over the benefits of a merger with bankrupt American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOOF

    New Frontier Media (NASDAQ:NOOF) +12.5% premarket after the adult-focused pay-per-view provider...

    New Frontier Media (NASDAQ:NOOF) +12.5% premarket after the adult-focused pay-per-view provider says it has retained Avondale Partners as a financial adviser to evaluate its strategic alternatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) trade 3.7% lower premarket after Eddie Lampert hits the CNBC...

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) trade 3.7% lower premarket after Eddie Lampert hits the CNBC airwaves (video) for a rare TV appearance that covered macroeconomic topics more closely than life at Sears - although he did tip off that he sees trends in retail favoring consumers over businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +32% premarket after announcing it has successfully drilled and completed...

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +32% premarket after announcing it has successfully drilled and completed its fourth operated horizontal well in the Bakken Shale, as the oil and gas company expands its presence in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +2% premarket on a NY Post story suggesting the company is in talks with...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +2% premarket on a NY Post story suggesting the company is in talks with Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) about a possible online gambling partnership. ZNGA, which sees huge revenue potential in moving to real wagering, needs to form partnerships with casino operators in a number of states if it is to cash in on an expected boom in internet gambling.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 7 Comments
  • MON

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON): FQ2 EPS of $2.28 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $4.75B (+15% Y/Y) beats by...

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON): FQ2 EPS of $2.28 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $4.75B (+15% Y/Y) beats by $220M. Shares +1.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) is removed from Goldman's conviction buy list, the firm saying there is...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) is removed from Goldman's conviction buy list, the firm saying there is little visibility towards near-term catalysts and better opportunities elsewhere. Shares -0.9% premarket.
